definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: That small town is the last far-flung outpost of our country.
sentences.chinese: 那個小城鎮是我們國家一個遙遠的前哨基地。

sentences.english: Just a couple of decades ago, the region was known as an outpost for soldiers guarding Greece.
sentences.chinese: 就在幾十年前，這個地方還是希臘軍隊的前哨站。

sentences.english: Objective To identify intraoperatively the feasibility of lymphatic mapping with methylene.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究亞甲藍術中定位胃癌前哨淋巴結的可行性。

sentences.english: Zoram'gar Outpost will be a Warsong Hold style base.
sentences.chinese: 佐拉姆加前哨站將會變爲一座戰歌堡風格的要塞。

sentences.english: Other remote American outposts have closed too.
sentences.chinese: 其他偏遠的美軍前哨據點也已被關閉。

sentences.english: The commandos attacked the outpost at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 突擊隊員於拂曉時襲擊了前哨基地。

sentences.english: Where can I watch The Outpost movie online free full stream?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪裏可以在線看電影免費的前哨充分流？

sentences.english: Skirmishes took place, and Earth became a place of duality.
sentences.chinese: 前哨戰開始了，地球變成了二元性的地方。

sentences.english: Their new outpost was on the crest of a hill.
sentences.chinese: 他們新的前哨陣地設在一座小山包頂上。

sentences.english: Zhaoyuan section is the frontage of monitoring water quality of Songhua River main stream.
sentences.chinese: 松花江肇源江段是松花江幹流水質監測的前哨。

sentences.english: A mounted sentinel stationed in advance of an outpost.
sentences.chinese: 騎哨先於前哨基地駐紮的騎馬的。

sentences.english: The troops received orders to trench the outpost .
sentences.chinese: 部隊接到命令在前哨周圍築壕加強防衛。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked in great numbers but our soldiers stood their ground.
sentences.chinese: 我們的前哨被迫撤回，預示敵人即將大舉進攻。

sentences.english: There was going to be a Soviet outpost in our backyard.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的後院中，他們將是蘇聯的前哨。

sentences.english: This is called sentinal node biopsy.
sentences.chinese: 這種手術叫做“前哨淋巴結活檢”。

sentences.english: The invading army overran a few scattered guerrilla outposts.
sentences.chinese: 入侵軍佔領了游擊隊若干分散的前哨基地。

definition: stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
